body: Hello Everyone, is there a proper way to assemble an EPConstruction for a rear ventilated facade? I didn´t find an air material, while composing, except for the window air material and the airwall material, which don´t seem to be the right choice.[](http://api.ning.com:80/files/suzYnbXNPs5CroNc-qu7r6BT79rip89QNICfc-h4hvVMfqRrvfZ6KOfftNf8QoV7alevAys8n6jagy3wcv9xNp8KzM-K15yE/ssss.PNG) Best regards, Dominik
topic: HoneyBee_EPConstruction air material for rear ventilated facade

replies.body: There is one air space material in the HB material library. Of course you can also add your own. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/suzYnbXNPs5HABmmx0r*5HD5wk-0ZL*VFWshSBFhRUMlVSBr-VeQtjnJUDf9Ci6p7-Q8Az42lUXxfvzE8QM*x5hZKxVQCqPC/Capture.JPG) -A.

Mhhhh and if i wanted to simulate this kind construction in THERM; what would be the material of choice? When I input the default air space resistance of honeybee i recieve the warning, that it has a conductivity of 0. Where it schould be something around 0.025 or 0.076921 according to this thread:  [http://www.grasshopper3d.com/group/ladybug/forum/topics/therm-examp...](http://www.grasshopper3d.com/group/ladybug/forum/topics/therm-example?commentId=2985220%3AComment%3A1429638&xg_source=msg_com_gr_forum) But the custom made THERM material doesnt seem to be the right one either because as far as I understand it is only useful for windows constructions while setting the cavity model? [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/Gzb*D4mTQDX5s2*FUI*-N6yuzlMLj6X*jt1wDu19Ay6oWWQn5gPFjGQ2jtCB7*gOn59JTSyPUJtVHJ4SvR5NlHp0VENrYd0Z/Therm.PNG) Is there some way to set up a material for a ventilated air space as part of a rear ventilated facade? Best regards, Dominik

Look at hydra examples like [this one](http://hydrashare.github.io/hydra/viewer?owner=chriswmackey&fork=hydra_2&id=THERM_Export_Workflow&slide=0&scale=4.469148552288882&offset=-285.4415386475287,-572.5322843397041) and [this](http://hydrashare.github.io/hydra/viewer?owner=chriswmackey&fork=hydra_2&id=THERM_Comparison_of_Stud_Wall_Constructions&slide=0&scale=8&offset=-1220.6296478747274,-652.554035174092) one (look for the "frame cavity" material).

-A.
Thanks again :) I thought this would only suit for window constructions.
